f254c0fa0512166d.title: Business Analyst
f254c0fa0512166d.desc:
A home is the biggest investment most people make, and yet, it doesn't come with a manual. That's why we're building the only app homeowners need to effortlessly manage their homes — knowing what to do, when to do it, and who to hire. With Thumbtack, millions of people care for what matters most, and pros earn billions of dollars through our platform. And as one of the fastest-growing companies in a $600B+ industry — we must be doing something right. 
  We are driven by a common goal and the deep satisfaction that comes from knowing our work supports local economies, helps small businesses grow, and brings homeowners peace of mind. We're seeking people who continually put our purpose first: advocating for pros and customers, embracing change, and choosing teamwork every day. 
  At Thumbtack, we're creating a new era of home care. If making an impact and the chance to do good inspires you, join us. Imagine what we'll build together. 
  Thumbtack by the Numbers 
 
 Available nationwide in all 3,143 U.S. counties 
 75 million+ projects started on Thumbtack 
 About 4 million customers in the last 12 months 
 Pros earn billions on our platform 
 About 10 million 5-star reviews for our stellar pros 
 1000+ employees and $3.2 billion valuation (June, 2021) 
 
 
  About the Business Analytics Team 
  The Business Analytics team's mission is to unlock strategic opportunities and enable Thumbtack to achieve its full business potential. To accomplish this mission, we focus on: 
 
 Business performance:  Metrics, dashboards, and forums that help us measure progress towards our goals and foster deep understanding of our business. 
 Strategic insights:  Analytics to uncover insights that will be game-changers for our business, and that inform company strategy and team execution. 
 Telling Thumbtack's story:  Using metrics and data visualization to tell Thumbtack's story to investors, board members, our team, and the world. 
 Building a world-class team:  hiring the best, and investing in coaching, learning, and team building. 
 
 We are a tight-knit group that is passionate about driving business impact through data science and analytics 
  About the Role 
  As a Business Analytics team member, you'll drive insights and action across the breadth of the marketplace. You'll be a steward of key company metrics and dashboards, and dive deep on analytical questions that are critical to Thumbtack's success. You'll partner with our leadership team to develop company strategy and goals, share performance updates with the Board, and work with teams across the business to drive actionable insights and business impact. This particular role will focus on business intelligence and business performance reporting. 
  Responsibilities 
 
 Define, measure, and track the key metrics that measure Thumbtack's success 
 Design and build key company data tables, dashboards, and insights tools that power decisions across the company, and evolve them as our product and business change 
 Lead business performance analysis and reporting to inform leadership of emerging risks and opportunities 
 Partner effectively with teams across the company, including Product, Engineering, Marketing, Operations, Finance, as well as Thumbtack's leadership team 
 Contribute to our team and company data culture through peer collaboration, training, coaching, and more 
 
 What you'll need 
  If you don't think you meet all of the criteria below but still are interested in the job, please apply. Nobody checks every box, and we're looking for someone excited to join the team. 
 
 BA/BS degree, preferably in Economics, Business, Math, Statistics, or Computer Science 
 2+ years of experience in a highly analytical role, preferably with experience in tech analytics 
 Proficiency using SQL to analyze large data sets 
 Experience with Look ML development and Looker dashboarding 
 Exemplary analytical problem solving skills, including solid statistics foundation, strong business judgment, and the ability to identify and synthesize insights from analysis 
 Ability to work with company executives to understand the company's business needs and drive decisions 
 Strong communicator, attentive listener, and compelling explainer 
 
 Bonus points if you have 
 
 Experience working in a marketplace business 
 Experience with R or Python 
 
 Thumbtack is a virtual-first company, meaning you can live and work from any one of our approved locations across the United States, Canada or the Philippines.* Learn more about our virtual-first working model here. #LI-Remote 
  For candidates living in San Francisco / Bay Area, New York City, or Seattle metros, the expected salary range for the role is currently $115,000 - $150,000. Actual offered salaries will vary and will be based on various factors, such as calibrated job level, qualifications, skills, competencies, and proficiency for the role. 
  For candidates living in all other US locations, the expected salary range for this role is currently $100,000 - $135,000. Actual offered salaries will vary and will be based on various factors, such as calibrated job level, qualifications, skills, competencies, and proficiency for the role. 
  #LI-remote 
 
 
  Benefits & Perks 
 
 
 Virtual-first working model coupled with in-person events 
 20 company-wide holidays including a week-long end-of-year company shutdown 
 Libraries (collaborative workspaces) in San Francisco, Salt Lake City, Toronto, and Manila 
 Stipends for remote work support, home office set-up and Thumbtack services (North America) 
 WiFi reimbursements 
 Cell phone reimbursements (North America) 
 Employee Assistance Program for mental health and well-being 
 
 Learn More About Us  
 
 Life @ Thumbtack Blog 
 How Thumbtack is embracing virtual work 
 Follow us on LinkedIn 
 Meet the pros who inspire us 
 
 Thumbtack embraces diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, age, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic information, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, state, or local law. We also will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, consistent with applicable law. 
  Thumbtack is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation for a medical condition or disability during any part of the application process, please contact: recruitingops@thumbtack.com. 
  If you are a California resident, please review information regarding your rights under California privacy laws contained in Thumbtack's Privacy policy available at https://www.thumbtack.com/privacy/ .

f3a4e0c24bab48ac.title: IT Business Analyst
f3a4e0c24bab48ac.desc:
The salary range for this job posting is $60,236.00 - $107,944.00 annually + bonus + benefits
  
  The above represents the salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, education, experience, and other job-related factors. Your recruiter can share more information about the specific salary range during the hiring process. 
 
 
 
   Encova Insurance has an immediate opening for an IT Business Analyst. 
   This role will have the option to work a remote, hybrid, or in-person schedule but you must reside within a two-hour driving distance to either our Columbus, Ohio or Charleston, WV offices for in-person work as needed.  We can hire at multiple seniority levels depending on candidate qualifications.
  
 
 
 
  JOB OBJECTIVE:
   
 
    To serve as a liaison between the business groups and IT, working closely with business partners to enable business success through IT solutions. The IT Business Analyst primary responsibility is to formulate and define requirements based on user needs and a good understanding of applicable business systems.
   
 
 
    They also serve as key partners to the IT Quality Assurance team to ensure requirements are converted to effective test plans, and to System Analyst, Architects, Development Teams, and Project Managers for decisions on the design of technology solutions to meet the business requirements.
   
 
 
    ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
   
 
  Business Requirement Documentation 
  Works with business representatives to define and document business problems. 
  Analyzes the problems defined and makes recommendations on possible solution alternatives. 
  Creates functional specifications to translate business requirements into application or process enhancements. 
  Facilitates the understanding, clarification, and implementation of business requirements and works with key partners in IT to turn those into functional system design. 
  System Development Life Cycle 
  Demonstrates working knowledge of the system development life cycle and associated tools used by Encova throughout the SDLC process. 
  Application Incident Management 
  Validates incidents against business requirement documentation to verify whether an incident is a production defect or an enhancement. 
  Reviews application incidents to determine root cause. 
  Collaborates with business partners and developers in proposing and documenting workarounds for incidents. 
  Quality Assurance Testing 
  Collaborates with QA analysts on the development of appropriate test plans and test cases based on the functionality written in business requirement documentation. 
  Executes test case scenarios and documents test results. 
  Project Management Tasks 
  Demonstrates working knowledge of the project management methodology and associated tools used by Encova throughout the Demand Management process. 
  Completes all project tasks in accordance with the timeline outlined within each assigned project. 
 
 
 
    OTHER FUNCTIONS:
   
 
  Apply current division and department standards. 
  Available for on-call production problem resolution 
  Maintains and continues development of information technology concepts and fundamentals. 
  Performs other duties as assigned. 
 
 
 
    POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
   
 
  Analytical Thinking & Problem Solving 
  Able to elicit, decipher and document technology needs to overcome problems faced by our business. 
  Creative Thinking 
  Ability to look at needs of stakeholders from different perspectives and suggest ways to communicate needs in a way that can be understood by IT. 
  Industry Knowledge 
  General understanding of the insurance business 
  Facilitation & Negotiation 
  Ability to moderate group discussions and enable participants to articulate their thoughts and ideas. 
  Ability to apply the proper process based on audience to attain the expected outcomes. 
  Oral and written Communication 
  Ability to express ideas, information, or other content in a clear and professional manner. 
  Ability to actively listen to ensure ideas generated by stakeholders are clearly understood. 
 
 
 
    EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS:
   
 
    Required:
   
 
  Bachelor’s degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Mathematics, Business or other related field. 
 
 
    Preferred:
   
 
  One year of information technology or insurance experience 
  One year of Business Analyst experience 
  Commercial lines policy experience 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  This position has been evaluated in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act. Encova Insurance makes every effort to reasonably accommodate disabilities to permit performance of the essential functions and candidates who need such accommodation are encouraged to seek it. This description reflects the nature and level of work performed by associates in this position. It is not an all-inclusive inventory of duties, responsibilities and qualifications required. It provides an accurate overview of the work and skills needed to perform this position. Because job content may change from time to time, Encova Insurance reserves the right to add and/or delete functions from this job as it deems necessary for business reasons. 
 
 
 
 
 
   Ready to join our team?
    At Encova Insurance, we firmly believe that our associates drive our company’s success by delivering unrivaled service to our customers. With success in mind, we make an ongoing effort to provide an environment that offers challenging, stimulating and financially rewarding opportunities.
   
  Join us to discover a work experience where your diverse ideas will be met with enthusiasm – where you can learn and grow to your fullest potential.
  
 
 
   What you can expect from us
    Join our family of industry leaders, and let us reward you with a competitive salary, bonus and benefits package that includes but is not limited to: a 401(k), wellness programs, bonus incentive plans and flexible schedules, with an early close of the office every Friday. Additionally, Encova aspires to be an outstanding corporate citizen in all the markets we serve; we encourage and support associate participation in community initiatives through our foundations.
   
  Encova Insurance is an EOE/E-Verify employer.

0b1a4de54b661109.title: Lead Data Analyst
0b1a4de54b661109.desc:
Who We Are: 
  SmithRx is a rapidly growing, venture-backed Health-Tech company. Our mission is to disrupt the expensive and inefficient Pharmacy Benefit Management (PBM) sector by building a next-generation drug acquisition platform driven by cutting edge technology, innovative cost saving tools, and best-in-class customer service. With hundreds of thousands of members onboarded since 2016, SmithRx has a solution that is resonating with clients all across the country. 
  We pride ourselves for our mission-driven and collaborative culture that inspires our employees to do their best work. We believe that the U.S healthcare system is in need of transformation, and we come to work each day dedicated to making that change a reality. At our core, we are guided by our company values of: 
 
 Integrity:  Do the right thing. Especially when it's hard. 
 Courage:  Embrace the challenge. 
 Together:  Build bridges and lift up your colleagues. 
 
 Job Summary: 
  With fast-paced growth comes a multitude of data-related opportunities to explore and challenges to navigate. SmithRx's Data Analytics team is at the forefront of wrangling vast amounts of data, unlocking their complexities, and harnessing their insights to generate value for present and prospective clients. We seek a Data Analytics Lead to assist us in these exciting endeavors. 
  The Data Analytics Lead will operate as a part of SmithRx's growing Data Analytics team and report to the Senior Manager, Data Analytics. You will function as a generalist to start, functioning as a liaison between the data team and our stakeholder teams, which we organize under three broad verticals:  Commercial Strategy ,  Operational Efficiency , and  Customer Satisfaction . You will manage the data team's day-to-day relationship with these stakeholder teams and ensure we are providing them with the resources they need to operate effectively. As the Data Analytics Lead evolves in their role, you will assume greater oversight of one of these verticals. 
  The Data Analytics Lead will support junior team members in diving deep into our data, hunting for the business insights that will support key business needs and communicating them to decision-makers. Furthermore, you will guide the team in exploring the intricacies of our data – searching for patterns and discovering trends that will inform our business understanding and contribute to organizational strategy for years to come. Finally, you will lead the way in designing creative metrics and appealing visualizations for reporting that effectively communicate our value proposition and enhance the SmithRx product. 
  Our goal is for the Data Analytics Lead to leverage their analytical rigor, business acumen, and prior experience to showcase the robust, meaningful, and cost-effective product offering we provide for our clients and members. 
  What will you do: 
 
 Lead the charge on partnering closely with our stakeholder teams to ensure all near and long term needs are scoped, documented, and have a place on the Data Analytics team's product roadmap 
 Provide thought leadership for best practices and shape the team's approach to data cleaning, governance, analysis, visualization, and dissemination 
 Guide team members in conducting rigorous, insightful analysis to not only answer the "what and when" questions, but also the "hows and whys" 
 Create visual snapshots that tell clear, compelling stories and illustrate how SmithRx's value proposition makes a real-world impact for customers 
 Manage ad hoc tickets via the team's helpdesk system, ensuring all tasks are assigned appropriately and have a clear timeline to completion 
 Provide end-to-end mentorship to the team, shaping both day-to-day operations and also the 3-5 year vision for the Data Analytics team 
 
 What will you bring to SmithRx: 
 
 7-10 years of work experience massaging, interrogating, drawing insights from, visualizing, and presenting data required (Healthcare and/or pharmacy experience preferred) 
 Bachelor's degree required / advanced degree preferred 
 Advanced skill in SQL required 
 Advanced skill in Looker required 
 Familiarity with additional data analysis tools (Python, R, Java, etc.) preferred 
 Familiarity with Salesforce or similar CRM platforms required 
 Familiarity with Jira or similar project management tools required 
 Familiarity with the Amazon Web Services (e.g. Redshift, SageMaker, S3 etc.) preferred 
 Robust analytical skills, ability to think critically about data and the stories they tell; experience integrating large sets of data from disparate sources 
 A curiosity and excitement to learn about pharmacy industry data 
 Strong communication skills via meetings and written correspondence 
 Self-starter mentality: ability to make informed decisions, find creative approaches to difficult challenges, and deliver on commitments 
 Execution-focused ethos - you are a solutions-oriented problem solver and efficiency driven 
 Flexible, adaptable, and able to respond under the pressure of a fast-paced technology company 
 SF preferred but Remote position can be considered for strong candidates 
 
 What SmithRx Offers You: 
 
 Highly competitive wellness benefits including Medical, Pharmacy, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance 
 Flexible Spending Benefits 
 401(k) Retirement Savings Program 
 Short-term and long-term disability 
 Discretionary Time Off 
 13 Paid Holidays 
 Wellness benefits- Spring Health, Gympass, and Headspace 
 Commuter Benefits 
 Paid Parental Leave benefits 
 Employee Assistance Program (EAP) 
 Well-stocked kitchen in office locations 
 Professional development and training opportunities

0430272d9e907c38.title: Sr Business Analyst, Transformation Office (100% Remote)
0430272d9e907c38.desc:
ARE YOU A CURRENT US FOODS EMPLOYEE? PLEASE APPLY DIRECTLY THROUGH OUR INTERNAL WORKDAY CAREER SITE. 
 
  Join Our Community of Food People! 
  
  The US Foods Transformation Office (TO) exists to drive outcomes from the strategic initiatives to transform and grow the company. This is done by executing the right initiatives, at the right time, with the right people through standardized and disciplined processes. 
  
  The purpose of the Sr Business Analyst is to drive the TO's mission by being a utility player with focus on performing complex analyses and providing meaningful insights on the strategic initiatives in the portfolio, owning the day-to-day management of the Wave portfolio tool, building innovative dashboards and views for senior stakeholders (including the ELT level) to make decisions, and drive communications, training, and a variety of tasks for the TO.
  
 
 This position has been segmented as Remote Anywhere meaning the work is completed 100% remote anywhere in the U.S. except Hawaii or United States Territories. 
 
 
 Responsibilities: 
 
 
  Perform complex analyses and provide insights on the TO strategic initiatives: 
  Performs weekly analytics and provides insights to help the TO leaders and Executive leaders understand drivers of value, progress and variances to the TO plan, and potential risks and opportunities across the efforts. 
  Reviews and ensures that the strategic initiatives are up to date in Wave (portfolio management tool) in preparation for weekly TO meetings - follows up with appropriate stakeholders when not updated. 
  Collaborates with leaders from the TO, Finance, HR, IT and others to ensure data integrity and to understand variations to the plan. 
  Manages and maintains the Wave portfolio tool, including building innovative new dashboards and views for senior stakeholders to make decisions: 
  Designated as the Wave expert for the TO and key point of contact for Wave requests/support (full onboarding will be provided for the role). 
  Manages Wave user and configuration management. 
  Manages Wave intake process for new requests and prioritizes those requests. 
  Develops views in Wave for team and stakeholders to support transparency and decision making. 
  Develops and maintains additional tooling and reporting (i.e., Power BI) for effective planning and execution. 
  Develops ad hoc analysis to support transparency and decision making. 
  Standardizes analysis for ease of replication and onboarding. 
 
 
  Communications: 
 
 
  Drives regular critical communications from the TO, including Direct to Field Calls, messaging to the broader Transformation leadership team, showcasing initiatives. 
  Partners with the corporate comms team to ensure quality of messages, timing, and formats for the TO comms. 
 
 
  Training: 
 
 
  Plays a lead role in development and execution of training for key stakeholders including the TO team and initiative owners. 
  Develops and presents training on Wave tool for new capabilities, features, reporting, etc. 
  Maintains and manages the Transformation Office SharePoint site including views, reporting, tools, and training. 
 
 
  Relationships: 
 
 
  Internal:  The business analyst will interact with many internal leaders including workstream leaders, initiative owners, and the full TO team. This includes senior leaders within the enterprise, up to an including the executive team 
 
 
  External:  Third party vendors, consultants and contractors 
 
 
  Minimum Qualifications: 
 
 
  Must possess a minimum of 5 years relevant experience 
  Demonstrates strong analytical ability, intellectual curiosity, attention to detail, and strong communications. 
  Strong customer service focus. 
  Thrives in problem solving and working with others to determine identify solutions 
  Able to learn and teach others about new processes and tech tools. 
  Coachable and ready to learn new skills (i.e., driving new analysis). 
  Ability to navigate new and ambiguous situations. 
  Distinctive ownership mindset and bias to action. 
  Able to work effectively in a fast-paced environment. 
  Able to quickly become proficient in tech tools such as Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Power BI 
  Less than 10% travel. 
 
 
  Education: 
 
 
  Bachelor's degree required in Business, Finance or related field, or equivalent experience required 
  Experience in finance, project and change management strongly desired 
 
 
  Certification/Training 
 
 
  Certifications in technology, project and change management are desired but not required. 
 
  The following information is provided in accordance with certain state and local laws. Compensation depends on experience, geographic locations, and other factors permitted by law. In 
  Colorado , the expected compensation for this role is between $78,700 and $105,000 . In 
  New York , the expected compensation for this role is between $92,800 and $123,800. In 
  California , the expected compensation for this role is between $88,200 and $117,600. In 
  Washington , the expected compensation for this role is between $88,200 and $117,600. This role is also eligible for an a nnual incentive plan bonus. Benefits for this role include health insurance, pre-tax spending accounts, retirement benefits, paid time off, short-term and long-term disability, employee stock purchase plan, and life insurance. To review available benefits, please click here: https://www.usfoods.com/careers/benefits.html .

7c9c43b0233e65c9.title: Manufacturing Data & Analytics Lead - remote
7c9c43b0233e65c9.desc:
Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s agricultural supply chain business, where we seamlessly connect farming customers with food, feed and industry. 
 Job Purpose and Impact 
 
  The Manufacturing Data and Analytics Lead will prepare business relevant information and reduce time to insight by leading technical activities that enable information capture, business intelligence and analytics competency. In this role, you will ensure teams have the data needed to make timely, accurate and actionable insights by investing in the core capabilities of data management, data engineering and key decision support applications that consume data. You will be a key partner between business needs and data engineering and will deliver the final information product including the dashboards that enable business value. Key Accountabilities 
 Design and implement internal process improvements, optimize data delivery and create scalable data sets. Build existing data assets and prepare data to meet specific reporting and analytics needs. Build data solutions to enable automated and self service data consumption. Model, design, develop, test and implement complex backend and front end structures to meet business visualization, reporting and analytics requirements. Evaluate the performance of processes, services and outcomes and recommend performance improvement. Partner collaboratively with data engineers on complex infrastructure projects and advocate for and emphasize the business value of applications and offer mentorship and technical solutions to solve business problems. Independently handle complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating only the most complex issues to appropriate staff. Ownership of metric calculations and data structure to enable standardization to a common structure across the business and cascade of metrics. Business product owner for deployment and sustainment of strategy around the data infrastructure that enables manufacturing asset twin work. Develop insights based on data patterns and report them to leadership. Other duties as assigned Minimum Qualifications 
 Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience Confirmed skills of enabling data content for reporting or analytics solutions Minimum of four years of related work experience Preferred Qualifications 
 
 Certification in programing language:  Python preferred Confirmed skills in querying relational databases with query language: SQL preferred Confirmed experience working with large data stores: Kudu and Snowflake preferred Power Platform Development experience would be an asset: Power apps and Power BI Ability to transform business needs into technical requirements Ability to collaborate with developers and data engineers 
 
  Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet.

84fce8e402cbb426.title: EH&S Data Analyst & Incident Investigator
84fce8e402cbb426.desc:
US-TX-Houston
    
 
 
 Job Description and Qualifications 
 
 EH&S Data Analyst & Incident Investigator Job Description 
 
  At Air Products, our purpose is to bring people together to reimagine what’s possible, collaborate and innovate solutions to the world’s most significant energy and environmental sustainability challenges. Grow with us as we embark on building tomorrow together by being the safest, most diverse, and most profitable industrial gas company in the world.
     
 
 Reimagine What’s Possible 
 
 
 EH&S Data Analyst & Incident Investigator Roles and Responsibilities: 
 
  We are seeking a EH&S Data Analyst & Incident Investigator within our GEMTE team located at our Houston. This position requires _30__% domestic / global travel.
     
  The Data Analyst & Incident Investigator is responsible for establishing databases that provide an opportunity to track all EH&S incident data from the Project’s in the Americas. Additionally, the incumbent will be responsible for supporting Incident investigations of Recordable and HPFA Events. Although primarily an office-based role, the incumbent will be required to spend time on Site to support investigations throughout the Americas.
      Job Description
      Collect and manage EHS data from various sources including incident reports, safety inspections, and compliance audits. Analyze EHS data to identify trends, patterns, and areas of concern. Support the development and implementation of safety campaigns. Collate incident reports for the SIRB monthly / Quarterly reviews. Participate in RCA’s when requested. Generate regular reports (Monthly, Quarterly / Annual) on EHS performance, including incident rates, compliance levels, and progress towards EHS goals. Work closely with Americas EHS staff to ensure accurate data collection and reporting. Utilize data analysis tools and software to effectively manage and analyze EHS data. Assist in the development of EHS policies and procedures based on data analysis. Support EHS audits and inspections by providing necessary data and analysis. Train other staff on data collection and reporting procedures as necessary. Stay current on local, national, and international EHS regulations to ensure accurate reporting. Participate in EHS meetings and present data analysis findings. Be familiar with all BSP tools. Performs incident investigations using cross-functional teams to interview witnesses, review procedures/regulations, gather timelines, and observe the scene. Then, determine causal factors and recommend corrective/preventative actions. Supporting the preparation of incident investigation reports and action plans.
     
 
 Required Skills / Abilities: 
 
 
  Bachelor’s Degree in EH&S or related science/engineering area.  
 Good English skills (reading, writing, & speaking).  
 Proven experience in data analysis and reporting.  
 Knowledge of EHS regulations and standards.  
 Proficiency in data analysis software and tools such as SAP-EM, Qliksense, MS-Forms and Excel.  
 Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.  
 Strong communication and presentation skills.  
 Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy.  
 Ability to work in a team and collaborate with different stakeholders.  
 Y-TREE, ICAM, SOLOGIC or TapRoot Training.  
 Working knowledge of best professional EH&S practices in conducting accident investigations, compliance audits and project health surveys.  
 Proficiency in assisting construction with development of risk assessments and associated job hazard analysis.  
 Demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a project team.  
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  
 Ability to explain, explore and discuss safety issues with range of stakeholders. 
  Skilled in working collaboratively with others in a complex integrated environment. 
 
 
  We are the world’s largest hydrogen producer with over 80 years of industrial gas experience. We are hydrogen experts delivering safe, end-to-end solutions, investing in real, clean energy projects at scale, and driving the industry forward to generate a cleaner future. 
     
  At Air Products, we work in an environment where we put safety first, diversity is essential, inclusion is our culture, and each person knows they belong and matter. To learn more, visit About Air Products.
     
  We offer a comprehensive benefits package including paid holidays and vacation, affordable medical, dental, life insurance, retirement plans/401(k), and sick time. You will be eligible for benefits and also be 100% vested in your retirement benefits on your first day of employment.
     
  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer (U.S.). You will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, citizenship, gender, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, or veteran status.
     
  Air Products is committed to working with and providing a reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If you have a disability and you believe you need a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening or to submit an online application, please e-mail us at talent@airproducts.com. General application status inquiries are not answered by this mailbox rather you’ll receive an e-mail directly from our Career Center and/or the Talent Acquisition Specialist.

ebea53c9d2c622fe.title: EHS Data Analyst
ebea53c9d2c622fe.desc:
Location: Remote 
  Exemption: Exempt 
 
  OUR COMPANY: 
  Ventura Foods is a leading global manufacturer of branded and custom food products that proudly helps food providers in the U.S., Canada and more than 60 other countries earn a special place on consumers’ tables. We do this by continually crafting custom dressings, sauces, mayonnaises, and other food solutions that exceed peoples’ expectations for great-tasting flavors and high-quality ingredients.    Headquartered in Brea, California, Ventura Foods operates 14 manufacturing facilities, 3 culinary centers, and numerous distribution centers across North America. When you work in our manufacturing and distribution facilities, you get a strong foundation of training, a manager who cares about you and celebrates your success, a safe environment, and challenging work. As part of our team, your future is limited only by how much you’re willing to push yourself to get there. We invest in your growth, because you invest in ours. 
 
 
 
  Position Summary: 
 
 
  The Environmental, Health and Safety Program Data Analyst will serve as the data guru for our Environmental, Health and Safety team, supporting a wide range of applications, data, and analysis requests related to environmental, health and safety. Reporting to the Senior Manager of Environmental, Health, and Safety, this role partners closely with a wide range of cross-functional partners including Production Management, Finance, Legal, Risk Management, and CSR/Sustainability. 
 
 
 
 
  Major Duties and Responsibilities: 
 
 
 
  Analyze data and develop insightful dashboards, memos, and presentations summarizing the data related to Environmental, Health, and Safety programs, projects, and performance. 
  Collaborate with the Risk Management, Production Management, Finance, and Plant Environmental, Health, and Safety teams to improve our data systems over time, including the data itself and the tools that will help us to analyze and interpret results and trends. 
  Compile Health and Safety data related to OSHA recordkeeping and other regulatory requirements to develop department scorecards. Develop tools and analysis to support decision-making related to how we prioritize Environmental, Health, and Safety initiatives. 
  Assist with the collection of large data sets from a variety of internal and external sources, organize data, clean and transform data into needed formats for further analysis. 
  Support value chain emission calculations using a variety of approaches, including spend-based and activity-based approaches, following the guidance provided. Support in research of developing methodologies and best practices. Conduct QA/QC of input data and calculations, troubleshoot inconsistencies in data or calculations, and assist in completing internal validation and 3rd party verification of data and calculations. 
 
 
 
 
 
  Education and Experience: 
 
 
 
  Bachelor’s Degree (or equivalent experience). Preferably in Environmental, Health, Safety, and Sustainability. 
  3 - 6 years of experience in a highly analytical environment (e.g., management consulting, corporate analytics, strategy, and operations, or other roles requiring a blend of analytical, strategic, and cross-functional work). 
  Experience working with VelocityEHS, Resource Advisor (Utilities application), or similar EHS applications, preferred. 
  Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel and PowerPoint, Outlook). 
 
 
 
 
 
  Knowledge and Skills: 
 
 
 
  Strong analytical skills and an ability to synthesize information across a broad system to diagnose problems and devise solutions. 
  Comfortable with ambiguity; able to thrive with minimal oversight and process, while keeping leadership informed on progress against deadlines. 
  Ability to thrive in a collaborative environment, possess an abundance of intellectual curiosity, focus on generating results, and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity. 
  Effective verbal, written and listening communication skills are required 
  Must be able to take on projects from idea through completion 
  Understanding the manufacturing production process, including organizational structure, terminology, equipment, engineering practices, etc. is a plus. 
 
 
 
 
 
  Why Join Us 
 
 
  Ventura Foods offers career growth opportunities as well as competitive compensation and benefits:  
 
 Medical, Prescription, Dental, & Vision – coverage beginning on your 1st day for eligible employees  
 Profit Sharing and 401(k) matching (after eligible criteria is met)  
 Paid Vacation, Sick Time, and Holidays  
 Employee Appreciation Events and Employee Assistance Programs 
  Salary Base Range of $91,331 – $112,000 for Employees Located in California* 
 
 
 The “base salary range” provided above is a good faith estimate of what we expect to pay for this position. The range provided is for California-based employees as Ventura Foods is required by California State Law to post pay rates. Ventura Foods reserves the right to pay outside of the given range based on a variety of factors including but not limited to: candidate skills and experience, complexity of the job, budgetary factors, and location/geography. Ventura Foods conducts regular reviews of compensation ranges and therefore reserves the right to alter this range at any given time. 
 
 
 
 
 
  Diversity & Inclusion: 
  Our commitment to a diverse and inclusive environment in which all employees are treated with respect is evident in our company culture and values. We believe that fostering an environment of inclusion and a focus on diversity across our organization is vital to attracting top talent, driving innovation, and meeting the high expectations of our customers in a rapidly evolving global marketplace. 
 
  Ventura Foods is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Crum & Forster Company Overview: 
   Crum & Forster (C&F) , with a proud history dating to 1822, provides specialty and standard commercial lines insurance products through our admitted and surplus lines insurance companies. C&F enjoys a financial strength rating of "A" (Excellent) by AM Best and is proud of our superior customer service platform. Our claims and risk engineering services are recognized as among the best in the industry.  
 Our most valuable asset is our people: more than 2000 employees in locations throughout the United States. The company is increasingly winning recognition as a great place to work, earning several workplace and wellness awards, including the  October 2023 Great Place to Work ®  Award  for our employee-first focus and our steadfast commitment to diversity, equity and Inclusion.  
 C&F is part of Fairfax Financial Holdings, a global, billion dollar organization. For more information about Crum & Forster, please visit our website: www.cfins.com. 
 
  Job Description: 
   IT Business Analyst - Data (Remote) 
 
  Business Overivew: 
 
  Crum & Forster provides specialty and standard commercial lines insurance products through our admitted and surplus lines insurance companies. Operating out of our corporate offices in Morristown, New Jersey, and ten regional offices, we distribute our products through approximately 1,500 authorized retail and wholesale brokers across the United States. We are looking for innovative, talented, and self-motivated individuals who are interested in working with a cross-functional team focused on implementing and supporting a CAESAR Data Warehouse (i.e. Enterprise Data Warehouse). 
  The C&F IT Organization leverages Agile principles to achieve success in its support of the business. IT resources are assigned to squads that have specific missions. Each squad consists of a cross-functional set of team members from the various disciplines that are needed to complete the mission. Business Analyst for Data Warehouse team in P&C insurance. 
   
 What you will do: 
 
  Describe the business need in the form of User Stories and Acceptance Criteria Organizes and documents supporting detailed requirements 
  Ensures that the other squad members have a clear understanding of the business needs and requirements Works closely with other team members to ensure quality deliverables that are fit for purpose 
  Provides a thorough analysis of issues & solutions 
  The position will also include analysis for Bureau Reporting (Unit Stat, ISO and Mass Auto, NCCI, SFAA) 
  The Business Analyst works very closely with all stakeholders including business customers, vendors, and internal resources in order to facilitate team communication and achieve the squad’s mission 
  Work with our Stakeholders and understand their business requirements 
  Work with the CAESAR team to come up with a solution to accommodate Business & Technical Requirements Liaison between business and technology 
  Analyze processes and data to identify any opportunities related to process optimization 
  Make a transformation or migration easier for our Business Translate complex business processes during development Create and finalize requirements for any new Reports Work with business and IT to integrate new data sets Identify opportunities to improve existing data sets Analyze data to improve Data Quality 
  Help users understand our data eco-system Bring more data awareness within business and IT 
  Work with the business and IT to mitigate current and future data issues or challenges 
  Ability to analyze and decompose problem statements, distilling these into clearly defined requirements. 
  A confident and effective communicator, with experience and comfort addressing and collaborating with IT and business stakeholders and other sr/jr team members 
  Ability to impart complex information in an easily digestible form, to both technical and non-technical audiences. 
  Act as a bridge between the Business and Technology using technical and analytical skills to enhance or implement new Data Warehouse processes 
  Identify ways to improve existing data quality 
  Validate data, as needed, and test applications for business requirements, functionality, and usability  Gathers, analyzes, defines, and documents requirements and communicates them to the technical & non-technical audience 
   -Define and deliver metrics, reports, dashboards, and data warehousing solutions for tracking and managing the business objectives -Identify ways to incorporate automation in any deliverables 
  Identify business challenges and initiate process improvement projects Facilitate and help modernize the data ingestion and consumption process Create Business flow/Data Flow diagrams  
 Create a Source to target mappings 
  Provide analyses for large datasets necessary for decisions using actionable insights Collaborate with various business groups to build scalable processes and metrics 
  Responsible for carrying out complex analysis of datasets and conducting appropriate data validation Responsible for gathering and validating datasets across multiple data sources 
  Responsible for identifying and implementing key insights  
 Provide information on analytic results to business and functional leaders using visualizations to communicate data and metrics, including data maps, leveraging Tableau, etc. 
  Define KPIs to track key business processes 
 
  What you will bring to C&F: 
 
  A bachelor’s degree and 3+ years of experience in Business Analysis of Data Warehouse, data, and its processes  
 Experience with writing complex SQL is a must 
  Excellent analytical, mathematical, and creative problem-solving skills Excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail 
  Highly self-motivated and directed 
  Understanding and working experience with cloud technologies is a plus (i.e. Azure, Snowflake) Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks  
 Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment Familiar with Jira, Confluence, and Agile Processes 
 
 
 
  #LI-MS
  
 
 
  #LI-REMOTE
   What C&F will bring to you: 
  
 Competitive compensation package 
  Generous 401K employer match 
  Employee Stock Purchase plan with employer matching 
  Generous Paid Time Off 
  Excellent benefits that go beyond health, dental & vision. Our programs are focused on your whole family’s wellness, including your physical, mental and financial wellbeing 
  A core C&F tenet is owning your career development, so we provide a wealth of ways for you to keep learning, including tuition reimbursement, industry-related certifications and professional training to keep you progressing on your chosen path 
  A dynamic, ambitious, fun and exciting work environment 
  We believe you do well by doing good and want to encourage a spirit of social and community responsibility, matching donation program, volunteer opportunities, and an employee-driven corporate giving program that lets you participate and support your community 
 
 
 
  At C&F you will BELONG
  
 
 
  If you require special accommodations, please let us know. We value inclusivity and diversity. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and welcome everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you require special accommodations, please let us know
  
 
 
  Crum & Forster is committed to ensuring a workplace free from discriminatory pay disparities and complying with applicable pay equity laws. Salary ranges are available for all positions at this location, taking into account roles with a comparable level of responsibility and impact in the relevant labor market and these salary ranges are regularly reviewed and adjusted in accordance with prevailing market conditions. The annualized base pay for the advertised position, located in the specified area, ranges from a minimum of $68,200 to a maximum of $113,600. The actual compensation is determined by various factors, including but not limited to the market pay for the jobs at each level, the responsibilities and skills required for each job, and the employee’s contribution (performance) in that role. To be considered within market range, a salary is at or above the minimum of the range. You may also have the opportunity to participate in discretionary equity (stock) based compensation and/or performance-based variable pay programs.

Insomniac Design  is a global digital agency headquartered in Washington D.C., with offices in London, Bucharest and Chisinau. We’re an agile, determined and innovative team organized by functional areas of expertise — Creative, Technology, Strategy, and Management. We specialize in human-centered design with deep focus on design thinking and digital transformation.
  
 
 
  The 
   Business Analyst  is critical to the success of Insomniac Design and will serve as a trusted advisor to our clients and internal teams throughout the entire product lifecycle, from discovery to launch and management. You’ll bring technical expertise and design knowledge to every project, with a focus on exceptional quality, business value, and precise delivery. The Business Analyst will ensure that our projects meet both business and user demands and are properly integrated into the business environment through actionable deliverables, including product requirements for functionality.
  
 Responsibilities: 
 
  Initiate and manage product requirements validating, gathering, and documentation process throughout the product development lifecycle

  Participate in technical discussions with clients, stakeholders, users, and internal team members to analyze, discuss, prioritize, and document new functionality 
  Collaborate with designers, strategists, and developers to define and validate functionality 
  Lead the documentation of technical and functional specifications 
  Support QA in writing and reviewing test cases and selecting critical test cases to form regression testing plans

  Assist the project manager in coordinating and monitoring client-side user acceptance testing 
  Partner with the product owner and lead developer to create and manage the product roadmap 
  Maintain and recommend reprioritizations to the product roadmap 
  Develop, maintain, and advocate thorough product documentation 
 
  Skills & Experience: 
 
  5+ years experience as a Business Analyst, Product Owner, or Product Manager 
  Proficiency in agile and waterfall methodologies for digital product development 
  Experience in creating and maintaining product roadmaps, requirements, user acceptance testing strategies, and maintenance documentation 
  Experience using digital development tools (i.e., Jira, Confluence, Figma) 
  Experience with Web Products built on a variety of platforms 
  Ability to lead client, stakeholder, and user-facing discussion 
  Knowledge of best practices in quality assurance (QA) and user acceptance testing (UAT) 
  Experience meeting critical deadlines, adapting quickly to shifting priorities, and managing multiple projects simultaneously 
  Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, and the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and succinctly to internal and external stakeholders (this is a client-facing role)

We are the leading provider of wildfire analytical solutions in the US and Europe.

The position is part of our technical implementation team to support customer implementation, data product development, on-going help desk, and product documentation. Interested applicants should visit our web site to understand more about our product offerings.

            We are seeking an experienced 
            Principal HR Technology Talent Acquisition and Performance Analyst  to join our global HR Technology Solutions Team. This is a remote position and can be located anywhere in the U.S./Europe/UK.
           
 
 
 
           The 
            Principal HR Technology Talent Acquisition/Onboarding and Performance Analyst  primary focus is the administration and day-to-day operations of SuccessFactors modules. The systems administrator is responsible for supporting the daily operations, customer support, maintenance, testing, troubleshooting, and reporting as needed. In addition, this role will provide talent and performance administration and technical support for our global organization.
             This role will be responsible for supporting and administering our SuccessFactors application suite and will partner with our impactful Talent, Onboarding and Performance business owners to develop and execute strategic projects, implementations, and be a key piece of the HR Technology team. Responsibilities will not only include managing system and data integrity but providing real-time guidance to key stakeholders on opportunities for improvement, alternative technology solutions, while remaining cognizant of local compliance implications. As this role is a key partnership with the Talent/Onboarding and Performance group, the preferred candidate must be able to work in a high paced, fast moving and continuously evolving environment where multitasking and prioritization are essential.
           
 
 
 
 Our Team 
  The HR Technology Solutions team is a central provider of both system support and solutions to the greater HR team. From providing real-time, impactful solutions to project implementation, HR Technology works collaboratively to directly impact and drive internal initiatives for over 20,000+ global employees. The HR Technology team prides itself on our ability to provide a flexible and supportive work environment for all team members to be themselves and maintain a strong work / life balance. All team members work collaboratively towards common goals while being highly productive. This ensures we all could provide meaningful contributions to the team, HR and Charles River as a whole. This role will be a key contributor to the HR Technology Solutions team and will have the opportunity to drive new projects and work with various parts of the business. If you are looking for a challenging role which will allow you to directly contribute and impact a global organization, this is a great opportunity.
           
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
            Job Responsibilities
           
 
 
 
  What You Will Do: 
 
 
 Serve as the SME and business analyst for technology projects / implementations 
 Perform deep configuration within SuccessFactors to meet business requirements 
 Act as Enterprise Administrator for SuccessFactors suite specializing in the Talent/Onboarding and Performance/ Succession modules 
 Partner with leaders across Talent and Performance and the greater HR team providing both support and guidance for HR technology systems 
 Drive projects from early stages through implementation, inclusive project scoping, configuration, and internal / external resource coordination to meet business requirements 
 Utilize Agile methodologies to build out product road maps and sprint plans to quick and efficiently execute projects. 
 Troubleshoot system issues and provide high-quality customer support on a global scale 
 Manage system release and enhancements while identifying possible gaps in system capability; providing system solutions as appropriate 
 Translate technical requirements into consumable information for non-technical stakeholders 
 Identify risks and system issues across all platforms and escalate as necessary 
 Actively involved in continued innovation to the HRIS technical infrastructure: research recommendations, leads improvements and solutions to improve user experience and support business processes. 
 Test, support and maintain modifications, utilities and tools associated with the system 
 Analyze and create ad hoc reports as needed to support business needs and initiatives 
 Serves as liaison to business and customers on HR Technology systems 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  Job Qualifications 
 
 
 
 
  Job Qualifications: 
 
 
 5+ years of SuccessFactors Analytical support experience 
 Previous experience within or in support of SuccessFactors Talent Acquisition and Onboarding Modules 
 Previous experience within or in support of SuccessFactors Performance and Succession Module 
 Extensive experience completing complex configuration within SuccessFactors Employee Central 
 Extensive experience completing complex configuration within SuccessFactors Administrative Support 
 Strong comfort level acting as an internal champion of HR technology at all levels of the organization 
 Problem solving/analytical skills; detail oriented 
 A strong ability to work independently while driving project timeline 
 Customer service orientation 
 
 
 
 
 
 Strongly Prefer: 
 
 
 Experience working within an Agile based project management / team management framework 
 Direct experience within Talent, Onboarding and Performance / Succession 
 Strong knowledge of GDPR and compliance 
 Experience with multiple modules of SuccessFactors 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
            Compensation Data
           
 
 
 
            The pay range for this position is $96K - $128K USD. Please note that salaries vary within the range based on factors including, but not limited to, experience, skills, education, certifications, and location
           
 
 
 
 
  IMPORTANT: A resume is required to be considered for this position.  If you have not uploaded your resume in your candidate profile, please return to upload field and attach your resume/CV.
        
 
 
 
 Vaccine Mandate 
  Charles River is a U.S. Federal Contractor. As a result, we must follow the Presidential Executive Order to mandate vaccinations, and ensure our employees are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Our main priority is the wellbeing, health, and safety of our people. We require proof of vaccination from all employees.
        
 
 
  Anyone with requests for disability-related and/or religious exemptions should contact Talent Acquisition (crrecruitment_US@crl.com) so that information can be provided about the accommodation process at Charles River.
        
 
 
 
 About Corporate Functions 
  The Corporate Functions provide operational support across Charles River in areas such as Human Resources, Finance, IT, Legal, Sales, Quality Assurance, Marketing, and Corporate Development. They partner with their colleagues across the company to develop and drive strategies and to set global standards. The functions are essential to providing a bridge between strategic vision and operational readiness, to ensure ongoing functional innovation and capability improvement.
        
 
 
 
 About Charles River 
  Charles River is an early-stage contract research organization (CRO). We have built upon our foundation of laboratory animal medicine and science to develop a diverse portfolio of discovery and safety assessment services, both Good Laboratory Practice (GLP) and non-GLP, to support clients from target identification through preclinical development. Charles River also provides a suite of products and services to support our clients’ clinical laboratory testing needs and manufacturing activities. Utilizing this broad portfolio of products and services enables our clients to create a more flexible drug development model, which reduces their costs, enhances their productivity and effectiveness to increase speed to market.
        
 
 
  With over 20,000 employees within 110 facilities in over 20 countries around the globe, we are strategically positioned to coordinate worldwide resources and apply multidisciplinary perspectives in resolving our client’s unique challenges. Our client base includes global pharmaceutical companies, biotechnology companies, government agencies and hospitals and academic institutions around the world.
        
 
 
  At Charles River, we are passionate about our role in improving the quality of people’s lives. Our mission, our excellent science and our strong sense of purpose guide us in all that we do, and we approach each day with the knowledge that our work helps to improve the health and well-being of many across the globe. We have proudly supported the development of 86% of the drugs approved by the FDA in 2021.
        
 
 
 
 Equal Employment Opportunity 
  Charles River Laboratories is an Equal Opportunity Employer - all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.
        
 
 
  If you are interested in applying to Charles River Laboratories and need special assistance or an accommodation due to a disability to complete any forms or to otherwise participate in the resume submission process, please contact a member of our Human Resources team by sending an e-mail message to crrecruitment_US@crl.com. This contact is for accommodation requests for individuals with disabilities only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.
        
 
 
 
        For more information, please visit www.criver.com.
        
 
 
 
 
 
   Nearest Major Market:  Boston    Job Segment:  Recruiting, Pharmaceutical, Laboratory, Business Analyst, Project Manager, Human Resources, Science, Technology

  Description 
 
  This position is eligible for remote work in the state of Texas (subject to change). 
  To apply for this position, complete an on-line application either through the Applicant Career Section through WorkInTexas. TxDMV does not accept paper applications. 
  Applicants who require an accommodation for the interview process should contact Human Resources at 512.465.4043 when contacted to schedule an interview. 
  GENERAL DESCRIPTION 
  Our mission at the Texas Department of Motor Vehicles (TxDMV) is to serve, protect and advance the citizens and industries in the state with quality motor vehicle related services. We are a dynamic state agency dedicated to customer service, consumer protection and the success of motor vehicle-related industries. 
  Performs moderate to complex (journey-level) consultative and technical activities in support of management-related programs and projects for the Texas Department of Motor Vehicles, Vehicle Titles, and Registration Division. Work involves assisting with research, legislative analysis, and planning, developing, and implementing department programs. Work may require contact with departmental managers, high-level executives, and private entities and involves assisting with coordinating the development of local, regional, or state projects and programs. Works under general supervision with moderate latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. 
  ESSENTIAL DUTIES 
  Collect, research, and analyze data required in the development of projects, initiatives, and programs. 
  Assist with the development of methodologies and specifications for department projects, initiatives, and programs. 
  Serve as an advisor to internal and external stakeholders on administrative, technical, and regulatory aspects of projects, initiatives, and programs. 
  Develop and evaluate policies and procedures for the implementation and administration of projects, initiatives, and programs and measures progress. 
  Assist with the development of business requirements, proposals, and studies. 
  Research policy issues proposed legislation, regulations, or rules to determine impact; and make recommendations. 
  Consult and communicate with other divisions, agencies, and stakeholders. 
  Conduct comprehensive reviews of statutes, rules, and or policies and prepare research for division and executive management. 
  May recommend and coordinate activities to produce more effective programs. 
  May provide input on developing and/or revising policy and procedure manuals. 
  Performs comprehensive reviews of literature, statutes, rules, and/or policies; and prepares administrative reports, studies, and specialized research projects. 
  Perform other duties as assigned. 
  The above statements are not a complete list of all responsibilities, duties and skills held or performed by employees in this job. Employees may perform other related duties as assigned. 
 
 
 
 
 
  Qualifications 
 
  MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS 
  Education and Experience 
  Bachelor’s degree from an accredited four-year college or university plus one (1) year experience in research, legislative analysis, or planning, developing and implementing a program for an organization. Additional related experience may be substituted for education on a year-per-year basis. (Experience requirements may be satisfied by full-time experience or the prorated part-time equivalent.) 
  ADDITIONAL INFORMATION 
  This position is eligible for  a remote work schedule   in the state of Texas (subject to change). 
  Remote work employees must meet these criteria for the remote work location: 
 
 Adequate desk space in a dedicated, contained area that is secured and protected at all times. 
 Remote work location is in a quiet environment free of background people and noise during business hours. 
 
 TRAVEL 
  May travel up to 5% of the time. 
  REGISTRATION, CERTIFICATION AND/OR LICENSURE 
  A valid Class "C" driver's license is required. If not currently a Texas resident, must obtain a Texas Driver's License within 30 days after entering Texas as a new resident. A satisfactory driving record is required for operating state or personal vehicles to conduct department business. 
  BENEFITS 
  The State of Texas offers a variety of benefits for you and your family that are comprehensive and, on average, make up about one-third of total compensation. Benefits include:

53b6e57c6b180c5f.title: Remote Work - Need Contact Center BA- locals to MA only
53b6e57c6b180c5f.desc:
must have 
 must be local! 
 Business Analyst 
 Contact/Call Center experience 
 Healthcare highly preferred  
 Current and future state processes 
 
 Location: local only they can work remotely and come onsite once a month or so  
 Start: ASAP  
 
 They need to have BA Healthcare experience and will be gathering requirements and building test plans. This will be a BA supporting the Phone Systems Replacement project. They are replacing the old Avaya system with RingCentral, and need to do other work that's adjacent to the RingCentral part of the project due to the impacts of switching to a VOIP system.  
 
 Below is some information from WellSense leadership regarding what they are looking for now:  
 
  Having contact center experience and background is critical. Contact center is a very unique beast compared to regular projects. So having that knowledge is critical. The core technology (Genesy, Avaya, RingCentral) etc. is not relevant. RingCentral and Pete's team have the technical infrastructure piece covered. Ultimately all these platforms are very similar. We need a BA to work closely with both our business groups to map out the current state and more importantly the future state. This will also require clearly mapping out the RingCentral features and which ones are relevant to our business and how we plan to use them. So any experience having done this in the past is critical. I am a big believer in team dynamics and the fit in our environment. So it's important to get a sense of the BAs personality and approach and if that can be a strength when added to our overall team Communication is key. So I tend to put a premium on that.

 Skills: - Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) certification required. - Experience working with children with special needs, particularly those with autism or developmental disabilities. - Knowledge of applied behavior analysis (ABA) principles and techniques. - Strong data collection and analysis skills. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with clients, families, and other professionals. - Ability to develop and implement behavior intervention plans tailored to individual needs.

dc2db2f6af4a8944.title: Data Analyst
dc2db2f6af4a8944.desc:
Job Title:  Data Analyst 
 Job Type:  Contract 
 Expected Hours:  40 hours, there is a possibility of getting 5 hours of OT per week. Candidate must be willing to work M-F 8am-5pm EST (Eastern Standard Time) 
 Location:  Remote, Hybrid option for candidates located in/around Pittsburgh, PA or Strongsville, OH 
 Job Description: 
 CEI's client in the financial industry is seeking a Data Analyst to join their team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for collecting data from various source systems, structuring it for analysis, and identifying items that require remediation. This role will collaborate with Business and Technical support teams to ensure data accuracy and manage risk effectively. 
 Key Responsibilities: 
 
 Collect data from various source systems, including Oracle Business Intelligence, Tableau, and more. 
 Utilize standard desktop applications to structure collected data for analysis. 
 Identify and remediate data anomalies based on established criteria. 
 Engage in regular meetings with Business and Technical support teams to discuss findings and drive solutions. 
 
 Skills and Qualifications: 
 
 Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office and other desktop applications as needed. 
 Familiarity with Tableau (not a developer, just a user or advanced user). 
 Familiarity with Oracle Business Intelligence (OBI) reporting (not a developer, just a user or advanced user). 
 Familiarity with ServiceNow (not a developer, just a user or advanced user). 
 Familiarity with JIRA (not a developer, just a user or advanced user). 
 
 Nice to Have: 
 
 The ability to work independently. 
 Understanding of LDAP (Oracle Unified Directory & Active Directory). 
 Understanding of server operating systems (Windows, Linux). 
 Understanding of Database technologies (Oracle, MS-SQL server, etc.). 
 
 Soft Skills: 
 
 Critical thinking. 
 Active listening. 
 Communicating effectively. 
 
 #INDGEN 
 Job Types: Full-time, Contract 
 Pay: $40.00 - $48.00 per hour 
 Expected hours: 40 per week 
 Benefits: 
 
 401(k) 
 Dental insurance 
 Health insurance 
 Vision insurance 
 Work from home 
 
 Experience level: 
 
 4 years 
 6 years 
 
 Schedule: 
 
 8 hour shift 
 Monday to Friday 
 
 Application Question(s): 
 
 Please acknowledge the following: 
 
 If you are located in the Pittsburgh PA or Strongsville OH area you will be required to work Hybrid.  Additionally, for remote candidates, this role is offered under the premise that you will be working M-5 8am-5pm EST regardless of location. 
 Work Location: Remote

300070c59d975042.title: Staff Software Engineer - Front End - Data Visualization
300070c59d975042.desc:
Company Description 
  At ServiceNow, our technology makes the world work for everyone, and our people make it possible. We move fast because the world can’t wait, and we innovate in ways no one else can for our customers and communities. By joining ServiceNow, you are part of an ambitious team of change makers who have a restless curiosity and a drive for ingenuity. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible. We dream big together, supporting each other to make our individual and collective dreams come true. The future is ours, and it starts with you. 
 With more than 7,700+ customers, we serve approximately 85% of the Fortune 500®, and we're proud to be one of FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For® and World's Most Admired Companies™. 
 Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow. 
 Unsure if you meet all the qualifications of a job description but are deeply excited about the role? We still encourage you to apply! At ServiceNow, we are committed to creating an inclusive environment where all voices are heard, valued, and respected. We welcome all candidates, including individuals from non-traditional, varied backgrounds, that might not come from a typical path connected to this role. We believe skills and experience are transferrable, and the desire to dream big makes for great candidates. 
  Job Description 
  In this role, you will be part of the ServiceNow Cloud Services Big Data Team. The Big Data team is building the next-generation platform that collects, stores and provides real-time access to large amounts of data. 
  You will be driving the design and implementation of ServiceNow in-house real-time data visualization and analytics platform to support the growth of ServiceNow. 
  What you get to do in this role: 
 
  Bring your innovation and experience in designing and developing the next generation data analytics platform using cutting-edge technologies. 
  Lead a global engineering team to drive end to end product design and implementation. 
  Standardize processes for complete development cycle including design, implementation, unit testing, code review, testing automation etc. 
  Research and adopt the right technologies to improve the scalability and productivity of the engineering group. 
  Work closely with key stakeholders and product owners to drive technical design for requirements of various use cases. 
  Coordinate with cross-function teams (DevOps, network, QA, etc.) to ensure a smooth cycle from development to deployment. 
 
 
  Qualifications 
  To be successful in this role you have: 
 
  6+ years of software development experience in data visualization, data analytics, BI tools and Hadoop ecosystem. 
  Hands-on experience architecting enterprise data analytics products with high scalability and performance. 
  Expert level skills with JavaScript, ReactJS strongly preferred along with NodeJS, Webpack or other modern UI frameworks, Java and REST API development. 
  Strong troubleshooting and debugging skills. 
  Experience and knowledge on ServiceNow Platform development is preferred 
  Ability to produce high-quality software that is unit tested, code reviewed, and checked in regularly for continuous integration. 
  Solid background in complicated SQL & data analytics. 
  Zeal for learning and adopting new ideas and patterns. 
  Strong Computer Science fundamentals, data structures, algorithms, and software design. 
 
  GCS-23 
  For positions in the Bay Area, we offer a base pay of $152,000 - $266,000, plus equity (when applicable), variable/incentive compensation and benefits. Sales positions generally offer a competitive On Target Earnings (OTE) incentive compensation structure. Please note that the base pay shown is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies and work location. We also offer health plans, including flexible spending accounts, a 401(k) Plan with company match, ESPP, matching donations, a flexible time away plan and family leave programs (subject to eligibility requirements). Compensation is based on the geographic location in which the role is located, and is subject to change based on work location. 
  Additional Information 
  ServiceNow is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status or any other category protected by law. 
 At ServiceNow, we lead with flexibility and trust in our distributed world of work. Click here to learn about our work personas: flexible, remote and required-in-office. 
 If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at talent.acquisition@servicenow.com for assistance. 
 For positions requiring access to technical data subject to export control regulations, including Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Government for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by the U.S. Government. 
 Please Note: Fraudulent job postings/job scams are increasingly common. Click here to learn what to watch out for and how to protect yourself. All genuine ServiceNow job postings can be found through the ServiceNow Careers site. 
   
 From Fortune. © 2022 Fortune Media IP Limited All rights reserved. Used under license. 
 Fortune and Fortune Media IP Limited are not affiliated with, and do not endorse products or services of, ServiceNow.
